> "Continue our duty, Odysseus," it says, and with its other hand reaches towards Odysseus' face. "Continue our battle."
> 
> Before it breathes its final breath, its blooded fingertips fall upon his metal body. It whispers something, and then, it's gone.
> 
> But not all of it fades away.

------

[[image NDAD.jpg]]

I recently finished Team The Mekhanisms' entry for Public Domain Con. It was incredible so I knew I had to draw something. Here's the result of an hour of trying to find markers that weren't dead.

This piece is based off: [[[nobody-dies-at-dawn-hub|Nobody Dies At Dawn]]] (By [[*user Ralliston]], [[*user Dino--Draws]] and [[*user Diogene_s]])

------

> Now, though, baptised as a witness of burning Adytum, from the city he emerges as a different man; one that does not know if he had ever deserved such gifts, if he had turned them to nothing but a sword. One who's a husk of his former pride, his former brilliance â€” one that, instead of a determined heart, now with him carries an empty, heavy conscience. A conscience of all that have died, since the dawn of empire, of all the blood shed on the altars of monarchs. A conscience of the burning, unsated need for it to stop.
> 
> From the city, he emerges as nobody at all.
author: vilsolad
